text: Albert Victor Young (August 8, 1899-November 10, 1956) is an American composer, arranger, violinist and conductor. == Biography == Young was born in Chicago, Illinois to Jewish family. == Records == Young was signed to Brunswick in 1931. == Radio, film and television == He received 22 Academy Award nomination for his work in film, twice being nominated four times, but he did not win during his lifetime. == Death == Young died on November 10, 1956 in Palm Springs, California. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1899 births Category:1956 deaths Category:American movie score composers Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Musicians from Chicago
title: Victor Young
